questions.prompt: What type of cable is commonly used for Gigabit Ethernet connections up to 100 meters?
questions.explanation: Cat 5e (or Cat 6) UTP cables support Gigabit Ethernet (1000BASE-T) up to 100 meters.

questions.prompt: CSMA/CD is used in wireless networks to detect collisions.
questions.explanation: Wireless networks use CSMA/CA (Collision Avoidance) because stations cannot detect collisions while transmitting. CSMA/CD is used in wired Ethernet.

questions.prompt: What is the minimum Ethernet frame size (including FCS)?
questions.explanation: The minimum Ethernet frame size is 64 bytes. If the payload is less than 46 bytes, padding is added. 1518 bytes is the maximum.

questions.prompt: The error detection method used in Ethernet frames is ____ (abbreviated).
questions.explanation: Ethernet uses CRC-32 (Cyclic Redundancy Check) in the Frame Check Sequence (FCS) field to detect transmission errors.

questions.prompt: What does the EtherType field value 0x0800 indicate?
questions.explanation: 0x0800 indicates IPv4. ARP is 0x0806, IPv6 is 0x86DD, and VLAN tagging uses 0x8100.

questions.prompt: What is the purpose of the Spanning Tree Protocol (STP)?
options: To prevent loops in switched networks
questions.explanation: STP (802.1D) prevents layer 2 loops in networks with redundant links by blocking certain ports until needed.

questions.prompt: In half-duplex mode, devices can send and receive data simultaneously.
questions.explanation: Half-duplex allows communication in both directions but not at the same time. Full-duplex allows simultaneous bidirectional communication.

questions.prompt: What Wi-Fi security protocol should never be used due to known vulnerabilities?
questions.explanation: WEP (Wired Equivalent Privacy) has serious cryptographic weaknesses and can be cracked in minutes. WPA2 or WPA3 should be used instead.

questions.prompt: What is the broadcast MAC address?
questions.codeSnippet:
Unicast: First byte even
Multicast: First byte odd
Broadcast: All bits set to 1
questions.explanation: The broadcast MAC address is FF:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF. All devices on the local network segment receive frames sent to this address.

questions.prompt: In the binary exponential backoff algorithm, after 3 collisions, the random wait is chosen from how many possible slots?
questions.explanation: After n collisions, the backoff is chosen from 0 to 2^n - 1 slots. After 3 collisions: 2^3 = 8 possible values (0-7).

questions.prompt: What does ARP (Address Resolution Protocol) resolve?
questions.explanation: ARP maps IP addresses to MAC addresses on a local network, enabling Layer 2 delivery of Layer 3 packets.

questions.prompt: IEEE 802.1Q is the standard for ____ tagging.
questions.explanation: 802.1Q defines VLAN tagging, adding a 4-byte tag to Ethernet frames to identify virtual LAN membership.

questions.prompt: What mechanism does Wi-Fi use to handle the hidden terminal problem?
questions.explanation: RTS/CTS (Request to Send/Clear to Send) allows stations to reserve the channel, preventing collisions from hidden terminals.

questions.prompt: Single-mode fiber optic cable can transmit data over longer distances than multi-mode fiber.
questions.explanation: Single-mode fiber has a smaller core and uses laser light, enabling transmission up to 100km, while multi-mode is limited to about 2km.

questions.prompt: Which encoding scheme guarantees a transition in every bit period, enabling clock synchronization?
questions.explanation: Manchester encoding has a transition in the middle of every bit period, ensuring the receiver can synchronize its clock with the incoming signal.
